item.title: Google Play Review Gameplan: devices trend and then history
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Enter the spreadsheets for January - March 2018
  • See if there's a device trend for specific devices like dreamlte aka Samsung S8
  • See if there's a device trend for specific family of devices (like the 19 variants of the Samsung S8 which together form what I will call a "family" e.g. the "Samsung S8" family)
  • Add review history and reply history
  • Devise a workflow for daily updating
  • Update daily somehow :-)

item.title: MongoDB query to find all Samsung S8s in the devices MongoDB collection
item.description:
Pontifications

  • The devices collection (see previous post about Google Play supported devices ) is created as follows using synthetic_add_device_branding_marketing_model.rb and utf8_supported_devices.csv :

How To make the devices collection

 ./synthetic_add_device_branding_marketing_model.rb utf8_supported_devices.csv

How to query for Samung S8

{
  "Retail Branding" : "Samsung",
  "Marketing Name" : /.*S8.*/
}
  • The above query returns 19 rows:
/* 1 */
{
  "_id" : ObjectId("5acbc5561115a9a462b64d58"),
  "Retail Branding" : "Samsung",
  "Marketing Name" : "Galaxy S8",
  "Device" : "SC-02J",
  "Model" : "SC-02J",
  "id" : "36a69c3ac08ae64aeac8f17562b6a6cb651e91b26cf67c70078e45adf4c01c3e",
  "synthetic_branding_plus_marketing_name" : "Samsung Galaxy S8"
}

item.title: NoSQL Manager for MongoDB Professional seems cool but expensive but Windows only, another one to try is RazorSQL any free MongoDB GUI tools on Windows that allow export to CSV?
item.description:
Pontifications

  • NoSQL Manager for MongoDB Professional seems cool but expensive but Windows only, another one to try is RazorSQL as well as a tool I've used on OS X in the past: Studio 3T
  • Any free MongoDB GUI tools on Windows that allow export to CSV?

item.title: Had to Reboot my Surface Book 2 again (twice in two weeks) to get WiFi working, ipconfig dance didn't work
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Had to Reboot my Surface Book 2 again (twice in two weeks) to get WiFi working
  • The ipconfig /release and then ipconfig /renew powershell dance didn't work after a week!
  • Other than this major :-) complaint, really like the computer and Windows 10 especially the Windows Subsystem for Linux.

item.title: Bookdown Tutorials for making books in R via hrbrmstr's posts on twitter in R
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Sean Kross: How to Start a Bookdown Book
  • Yihui Xie: bookdown: Authoring Books and Technical Documents with R Markdown
  • The above two links via hrbrmstr's posts on twitter in R:
    • A bookdown “Hello World” : Twenty-one (minus two) Recipes for Mining Twitter with rtweet
    • Can’t Stop at 21: Twitter Recipe #22 — Tying Up Loose Threads

item.title: Only a strong and democratic world government and strong regulation by that government will save us from climate change and digital malfeasance
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Not effective enough for the USA (or even Russia or China or whoever) to do this on their own.

item.title: No unique identifier in Google Play's CSV file of supported devices
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Hilariously bad :-) : No unique identifier in Google Play's CSV file of supported devices
  • Maybe Google has it but doesn't want to export it or maybe Android just doesn't have it due to a bad design decision at the beginning of Android? Maybe something else :-) ?!?
  • Anyhow if I hash together all 4 fields: Retail Branding, Marketing Name, Device and Model, I do get something unique, hooray
  • Here's the code from: synthetic_add_device_branding_marketing_model.rb :
id_hashstr = ""
id_hashstr +=  d1["Retail Branding"] if !d1["Retail Branding"].nil?
id_hashstr +=  d1["Marketing Name"] if !d1["Marketing Name"].nil?
id_hashstr +=  d1["Device"] if !d1["Device"].nil?
id_hashstr +=  d1["Model"] if !d1["Model"].nil?
d1["id"] = Digest::SHA2.new(256).hexdigest(id_hashstr)

item.title: Mongodb query in javascript showing '$or' syntax
item.description:
Pontifications

{  
  "firefox_major_version" : 57,  
  "Reviewer Language" : "en",  
  "$or" : [{"star_rating" : 1 }, {"star_rating" : 2}]
}

item.title: Google's official document for Google Play device name to marketing name mapping e.g. 'SM-N950W' to 'Samsung Note 8'
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Google Play's prosaically named Supported Devices is Google's official document for Google Play device name to marketing name e.g. 'SM-N950W' to 'Samsung Note 8'. Available in CSV and PDF

item.title: Nathan Yau:How to Make Chord Diagrams in R
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Another great tutorial from Flowing Data and Nathan Yau: How to Make Chord Diagrams in R
